results.title: Roller skating safety
results.brief_description: Gives step-by-step lessons in roller skating through the story of a roller-rink skater who teaches her younger brother how to move on skates. In turn, the brother teaches his sister how to move safely on skates outside the rink. Emphasises that safety and etiquette are more important than the mechanics of the sport. Outlines the selection and adjustment of equipment, use of protective pads, how to fall, stop and turn. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Roller skate safely
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of protective wear in roller skating and also stresses the importance of routine safety and maintenance checks to skates. A variety of skates are shown, with suggestions for purchase or rental. Shows the important basic techniques of how to stop and how to fall.

results.title: Rolf Harris in Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: International TV artist, musician and comedian Rolf Harris visits the major tourist attractions of Tasmania. The film highlights national parks, islands, buildings, cities and towns, as well as industrial undertakings such as mining, paper mills, forestry and hydro-electric works. The leisurely pace of life and the recreational facilities of Tasmania are emphasised through the eyes of this famous Australian.

results.title: Role playing in human relations training
results.creator_credit: John H. Cunningham and National Training Laboratory in Group Development
results.brief_description: Five role playing scenes are shown. The activities of the leader of a Mothers’ Club in setting up a role playing situation getting it started, cutting the scene and discussing it afterwards. Two problems of family living showing how insight is gained into human relations problems by demonstrating and analysing the effects of different kinds of behaviour. A community problem demonstrating the use of the commentator soliloquy and interview in role playing. A supervisory training group making use, through role playing, of an expert who communicates some of his supervisory skills to the trainees by acting them out rather than by verbal explanation.

results.title: Role of the combat cameraman
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description: Traces the role played by the combat photographer from World War I to Korea. Shows the photographers in action on land, in the sky, and on the sea as they use their cameras and talent as a source of historical record, military intelligence, and as an aid in training troops. In addition to showing combat scenes, other important events, such as atomic blasts, enemy surrenders, and features of large scale combat operations, are depicted.

results.title: Role call
results.brief_description: Looks at sexism and sex-role stereotyping and explores many of the commonly held myths. Shows two secondary schools where students participate in a “progressive coeducational” program and notes both teacher and student attitudes to their roles. We see this through woodwork, sewing, cooking and sports. However, issues such as non-gender specific language and parental attitudes are also raised and explored. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Rohani steps out
results.brief_description: A shy young Malay housewife, Rohani, is persuaded by the village headman’s wife to join her local Women’s Institute. There she finds companionship in learning new crafts and skills among women of different races and creeds. Later Rohani is able to help other housewives, by teaching them the skills she has acquired, and by persuading them to join the Women’s Institue.

results.title: Rogopag [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ugo Tognazzi, Jean-Luc Godard, Pier Pasolini, Roberto Rossellini, Alfredo Bini, Societe Cinematographique Lyre (Paris), Cineruz and Arco Film (Italy)
results.brief_description: This is an anthology of four short comedies. The first episode, Rossellini’s (Ro) farewell to cinema (he worked in television thereafter), is a light-hearted play on the difference between the ‘Anglo-Saxon’ and ‘Latin’ character and the idea of cinematic illusion. The Pasolini (Pa) segment is located on the set of a biblical epic, (Orson Welles is the director) and is full of ideas which Pasolini developed elsewhere in his novels, poetry and films. Godard’s (Go) episode is a kind of science fiction story, foreshadowing Alphaville, set in a Paris transformed but not destroyed by a nuclear bomb. Gregoretti’s (G) piece is distinguished mainly by the presence of the great comic actor Ugo Tognazzi. Contents: Illibatezza Chastity (31 min.) ; Ricotta Curd cheese (b&w, col., 35 min.) ; Nuovo New world (19 min.)—Pollo ruspante Free-range chicken (32 min). Cast includes Rosanna Schiaffino (Illibatezza), Orson Welles (Ricotta), Jean-Marc Bory (Nuovo mondo) and Ugo Gregoretti (Pollo ruspante). In Italian and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Rogerstone
results.creator_credit: Northern Aluminium Company and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: A survey of the continuous aluminium strip rolling mill at Rogerstone, where modern machinery, mechanical handling and efficient factory layout enable single ingots of aluminium to be rolled in continuous lengths of as much as 3,500 feet. The opening of this mill in 1950 increased Britain’s aluminium sheet rolling capacity by one-third.
